intro: Eriostemon uniflorus, commonly known as the single-flower eriostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white and are clustered in inflorescences. Eriostemon uniflorus is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions.
